overview:
Bradley Holt is a web developer, entrepreneur, community facilitator, and an advocate of free/open source software, open standards, and open content (e.g. Creative Commons).

He is the co-founder of Found Line, a Vermont-based creative studio with capabilities in web development, graphic design, and marketing strategy. He is a Board Member at Vermont Community Access Media (VCAM), a non-profit community media and technology center that provides local citizens access to training and state-of-the-art digital video tools as a means of personal, political, and artistic self-expression.

He organizes the Burlington, VT PHP Users Group and is involved with helping to organize other technology community events such as Vermont Code Camp. He is involved in the open source communityâ€”specifically with PHP and Zend Framework through participation in mailing lists, conferences, and the occasional code contribution. He spoke on the role of local user groups during ZendCon â€˜09, a PHP conference that took place in Silicon Valley. He is a regular speaker at his local PHP users group and use a Creative Commons license for all of my presentation material, allowing others to re-purpose his material if it is helpful to them.

His company, Found Line, created a website, tmdvt.net, for Vermontâ€™s Town Meeting Day with the goal of encouraging free speech and democratic participation. CCTV Center for Media & Democracy partnered with Found Line to create CommonGoodVT.org, a â€œnetwork that enables community and nonprofit leaders to access their collective knowledge, build partnerships, solve problems and achieve long-term social benefit for the people of Vermont.â€ They also helped VSA Vermont make the world of the arts accessible to Vermonters of all abilities by building an accessible website through which they could communicate.
